paper.title: A novel robust method for large numbers of gross errors

paper.venue: International Conference on Control, Automation, Robotics and Vision
paper.abstract: In computer vision tasks, it frequently happens that gross noise occupies the absolute majority of the data. Most robust estimators can tolerate no more than 50% gross errors. In this article, we propose a highly robust estimator, called MDPE (maximum density power estimator), employing density estimation and density gradient estimation techniques in the residual space. This estimator can tolerate more than 85% outliers. Experiments illustrate that the MDPE has a higher breakdown point and less errors than other recently proposed similar estimators: least median of squares (LMedS), residual consensus (RESC), and adaptive least kth order squares (ALKS).
